column4: definition

column2: How should we connect to your data?
column4: Sets a name for your connector.
column8: A string at most 64 characters long

column4: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode.
Kafka API Key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.
The Service Account that will be used to generate the API keys to communicate with Kafka Cluster.
Secret associated with Kafka API key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

column2: How should we connect to your MongoDB Atlas database?
column4: MongoDB Atlas connection host (e.g. confluent-test.mycluster.mongodb.net).

column2: How should we connect to your MongoDB Atlas database?
column4: MongoDB Atlas connection user.

column2: How should we connect to your MongoDB Atlas database?
column4: MongoDB Atlas connection password.

column2: How should we connect to your MongoDB Atlas database?
column4: MongoDB Atlas database name. If not set, all databases in the cluster are watched.
Single MongoDB Atlas collection to watch. If not set, all collections in the specified database are watched.
Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior differently from the Connect framework's.
The server API version to use. Disabled by default.
Sets whether the connector requires use of deprecated server APIs to be reported as errors.
Sets whether the application requires strict server API version enforcement.

column2: Number of tasks for this connector
column4: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.
The converter class for the headers. This is used to serialize and deserialize the headers of the messages.
Allow optional string map key when converting from Connect Schema to Avro Schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.
Specify if the Serializer should attempt to register the Schema.
Allow the Connect converter to add its metadata to the output schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.
Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information and Enums. Applicable for Avro Converters.
Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether to flatten unions (oneofs). Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether to generate an index suffix for unions. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether to generate a struct variable for null values. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether to represent enums as integers. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Verify latest subject version is backward compatible when use.latest.version is true.
Whether to allow additional properties for object schemas. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.
Whether nullable fields should be specified with an optional label. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether proto2 optionals are supported. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether to scrub invalid names by replacing invalid characters with valid characters. Applicable for Avro and Protobuf Converters.
Use latest version of schema in subject for serialization when auto.register.schemas is false.
Whether to set non-required properties to be optional. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.
Whether nullable fields should use primitive wrapper messages. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.
Whether a wrapper message should be interpreted as a raw primitive at root level. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior. WARNING: This property should be used with CAUTION for SOURCE CONNECTORS as it may lead to dataloss. If you set this property to 'all', the connector will not fail on errant records, but will instead log them (and send to DLQ for Sink Connectors) and continue processing. If you set this property to 'none', the connector task will fail on errant records.
How to construct the subject name for key schema registration.
Whether to replace fields that have a default value and that are null to the default value. When set to true, the default value is used, otherwise null is used. Applicable for JSON Key Converter.

Include schemas within each of the serialized keys. Input message keys must contain schema and payload fields and may not contain additional fields. For plain JSON data, set this to false. Applicable for JSON Key Converter.

Specify the JSON/JSON_SR serialization format for Connect DECIMAL logical type values with two allowed literals: BASE64 to serialize DECIMAL logical types as base64 encoded binary data and NUMERIC to serialize Connect DECIMAL logical type values in JSON/JSON_SR as a number representing the decimal value.
Whether to flatten singleton unions. Applicable for Avro and JSON_SR Converters.
When set to true, this property ensures that the corresponding record in Kafka is NULL, instead of showing the default column value. Applicable for AVRO,PROTOBUF and JSON_SR Converters.

Set the subject reference name strategy for value. Valid entries are DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy or QualifiedReferenceSubjectNameStrategy. Note that the subject reference name strategy can be selected only for PROTOBUF format with the default strategy being DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy.
Whether to replace fields that have a default value and that are null to the default value. When set to true, the default value is used, otherwise null is used. Applicable for JSON Converter.

Include schemas within each of the serialized values. Input messages must contain schema and payload fields and may not contain additional fields. For plain JSON data, set this to false. Applicable for JSON Converter.
Determines how to construct the subject name under which the value schema is registered with Schema Registry.
Enable connector to automatically restart on user-actionable errors.
Identifies the connector plugin name.
